data.title: Mitt Romney Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Mitt Romney with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Originally enrolled at Stanford University in 1965, but left after one year for a thirty-month Mormon mission in France

Began his business career as a corporate adviser for the Boston Consulting Group in 1976

Co-founded the investment firm Bain Capital in 1984

Ran for a seat in the U

S

Senate in Massachusetts in 1994, but lost to long-time Democrat incumbent Ted Kennedy

Served as the president of the Salt Lake Organizing Committee for the 2002 Olympic Games in Salt Lake City

Elected Governor of Massachusetts in 2002, and served in office from 2003 to 2007

Ran for President in 2008, losing out in the Republican primaries to John McCain

Won the Republican nomination for President in 2012, but was defeated in the general election by President Barack Obama
